title: LVXIN Legal - Users Dashboard
activity_overview: An overview of your contract analysis activity
hero_subtitle: Pioneering advanced AI-powered legal solutions for modern businesses
service1_subtitle: Get a clear and professional analysis of your contracts, highlighting hidden risks, defects, and potential pitfalls to protect your interests.
ocr_note: Note! (If your file contains images) we are developing an OCR function, until we finish, please convert your documents to text before uploading
drop_files_or_click: Drop files here or click to upload
service2_subtitle: Chat with our intelligent legal agent to get quick, clear, and tailored solutions to your legal questions, backed by expert logic.
step1_desc: Upload any legal document in a supported format
step2_desc: Our AI analyzes the document to identify risks and opportunities
step3_desc: Review the highlighted risks and suggested improvements
step4_desc: Export detailed reports and revised documents
risk1_desc: The non-compete clause extends for 5 years, which is beyond the legally enforceable limit in most jurisdictions. Recommendation: Reduce to 1-2 years.
risk2_desc: The 3-day notice period is shorter than the standard 30-day requirement in many jurisdictions, which could lead to compliance issues.
risk3_desc: The annual salary review clause lacks specific criteria for increases. Suggest adding performance metrics for clarity.
service_card1_desc: AI-powered contract analysis and optimization to identify risks
service_card2_desc: Real-time business performance tracking and compliance monitoring
service_card3_desc: Comprehensive market valuation analysis and competitive insights
testimonial_text: LVXIN transformed our legal operations. We achieved 85% faster compliance checks and reduced operational costs by 40% in the first quarter!
testimonial_author_title: Legal Director at a Shenzhen Tech Firm
cta_title: Start Your AI Legal Journey Today
cta_subtitle: Experience LVXIN with our 14-day free trial, no credit card required.
our_story_content: Founded in January 2025, Lvxin was born from a mission to revolutionize China's legal services with advanced AI. Based in Shenzhen, our team combines legal expertise with cutting-edge AI innovation to make legal assistance accessible, efficient, and affordable.
our_mission_content: To democratize legal services in China through innovative AI solutions, making legal assistance accessible, efficient, and affordable for all.
value1_content: Committed to excellence in all our operations
value2_content: Upholding ethical standards in all dealings
value3_content: Making legal services open to everyone
exec_summary_content: Platform usage increased by 2% this month, with over 40 analyses. User satisfaction remains high at 94%. Key risk areas identified in employment contracts and NDAs. Revenue at $283,500, exceeding targets by 10%. Opportunity areas: Expand HR templates to increase enterprise client adoption.
exec_insight_1: Insight: Dip in conversion rate linked to limited HR template development. Recommendation to expand 5 HR templates by April 15.
exec_action_1: Action: Assign Li Jun to lead template expansion by April 15.
exec_alert_1: 20% drop in enterprise client Tech Corp this month
exec_alert_2: 8 high-priority flags in employment contract analyses
team_risk_summary_content: The team identified 1,243 contractual risk issues this period (a 6% increase from last month). Critical risks are up 12%, concentrated in IP clauses for tech industry contracts. Remediation rate is at 76%, with best performance on financial clause issues. China jurisdiction.
team_resolution_time: Time to Resolution: 3.4 days (0.6 days faster than last month)
team_critical_alert_1: 28 high-risk IP clauses in Tech Corp contract. Assign review team.
team_alert_1: New privacy regulations impact 43 contracts in China.
risk_emerging_alert_1: New data privacy laws (China) projected to impact 42 contracts by July 2025
risk_emerging_alert_2: IP protection changes (USA) urgent due to ongoing licensing lawsuits
risk_emerging_alert_3: Payment term trends: Industry shifting from Net-60 to Net-45
decision_critical_risk_title: Critical IP Risk: Tech Corp Service Agreement
decision_critical_risk_content: IP clause assigns all developed technology to the client without restriction, conflicting with Article 326 of Chinese contract law on independent pre-existing rights.
decision_action_1: Primary recommendation: Propose alternative clause limiting IP assignment to work created specifically for the client project as defined in the statement of work, while retaining rights to pre-existing work.
decision_action_2: Alternative approaches: Dual licensing model, Escalation path, Legal precedent
cross_element_1_desc: 'All intellectual property shall be vested in...'
cross_element_2_desc: 'Contractor shall be liable for all damages...'
cross_element_3_desc: 'Dispute resolution shall be in the jurisdiction of...'
cross_fix_summary: 78% of all issues can be fixed with standardized template updates

risks.qualification_not_specified: Contract party qualifications not clearly specified
risks.analysis_details: Since the contract text does not clearly specify the specific identity information of Party A and Party B, such as whether a natural person has full civil capacity or whether a legal person is legally established and validly existing, nor does it mention that both parties need to show each other proof of identity and existence and qualifications before signing the contract, there may be legal risks during contract execution.
risks.brief_details: The contract lacks clear identification requirements for both parties, which could lead to legal issues regarding the validity and enforceability of the contract.

suggestions.page_description: This is the suggestions page showing recommended amendments.
suggestions.api_content: It will display original content alongside suggested modifications from the API.
suggestions.title: Suggestions
suggestions.no_suggestions: No suggested modifications available for this section.
